channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid in Wales: Vaccine passport decision due on Friday
item.description: Pass plans not ruled out in Wales amid concern that it could be damaging for nightclub trade.

item.title: Wrexham woman, 98, confronts three men in 'sickening' burglary
item.description: She challenged the burglars and after a "brief confrontation", they escaped empty handed.

item.title: Campaign to halt development of Carmarthenshire quarry
item.description: About 600 people have signed a petition to protect "one of the most beautiful parts of Wales".

item.title: Cardiff Indoor Arena: World-class venue set to attract jobs and visitors
item.description: Backers say "world-class" 15,000-capacity venue would attract one million people a year to Cardiff.

item.title: Logan Jones inquest: Hospital staff 'failed' boy, 8
item.description: But coroner Caroline Saunders says she is uncertain the failures contributed to Logan Jones's death.

item.title: Dating site fraud: Rhyl barber jailed for Â£90,000 con
item.description: 'Sophisticated' Esosa Eromosele sentenced to 18 months after conning money from women online.

item.title: Swansea man jailed after CCTV operator witnessed rape
item.description: Turkey Al-Turkey is sentenced to eight years and eight months for raping a woman in Swansea.

item.title: Green Man 20th anniversary sold out 11 months before festival
item.description: Mercury prize winner Michael Kiwanuka is confirmed for Welsh festival's 20th anniversary event.

item.title: Senedd talks: Lib Dems right not to be in discussions, says leader
item.description: Jane Dodds is right not to help Mark Drakeford's government in the Senedd, says Lib Dem leader.

item.title: Electric cars a danger to the blind, say charities
item.description: One man says he often has near-misses and would have been hurt if it was not for his guide dog.

item.title: London arms fair DSEI attended by Welsh government
item.description: Plaid called the event "contemptible" but the Tories said it was right for officials to go.

item.title: Sir Clive Sinclair: Computing pioneer dies aged 81
item.description: The inventor, entrepreneur and ZX Spectrum creator died at his London home following a long illness.

item.title: Electric cars: 'People with sight loss are in danger'
item.description: Blind and visually impaired people say quiet hybrid and electric vehicles put their lives in danger.

item.title: Disused Carmarthenshire quarry 'needs to be protected'
item.description: About 600 people have signed a petition to protect "one of the most beautiful parts of Wales".

item.title: Covid: Doctor combating jab myths called Dr Death by trolls
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani uses social media to dispel vaccine misinformation.

item.title: Care home owners fear legal action over Covid could cause bankruptcy
item.description: Care home owners fear homes could face closure without the same protection from claims as the NHS.

item.title: Gleision: 'Guilt of surviving mine disaster with me forever'
item.description: A decade on from the Gleision mine disaster, two men who survived still carry the weight of the tragedy.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Eluned Morgan announces booster jab plan
item.description: Eluned Morgan explains the Covid vaccination plans for 12 to 15-year-olds and the over-50s.

item.title: Women's World Cup qualifier: Wales v Kazakhstan
item.description: Preview followed by live coverage of Friday's Women's World Cup Qualifying game between Wales and Kazakhstan Women.

item.title: Rhys Webb: Wales ambition still burns brightly for Ospreys scrum-half
item.description: Ospreys and British and Irish Lions scrum-half Rhys Webb says he retains his ambition to play for Wales.

item.title: George North: Lions and Wales back signs new dual contract with Ospreys and Welsh Rugby Union
item.description: Wales and Lions back George North signs two-year tailored agreement with Ospreys and the Welsh Rugby Union.

item.title: Alan Tate: Former captain switched from Swansea coaching role
item.description: Former captain Alan Tate is expected to take up new duties at Swansea City as he leaves the first-time coaching set-up.

item.title: Hayley Ladd column: A massive campaign for Wales
item.description: In her first BBC Sport column Wales' Hayley Ladd looks ahead to the upcoming World Cup qualifying campaign, which starts at home to Kazakhstan and away in Estonia.

item.title: Nyrs o Lanelwy yw'r cyntaf i gael brechlyn atgyfnerthu
item.description: Bwrdd iechyd y gogledd yw'r cyntaf i roi brechlynnau atgyfnerthu yn erbyn Covid-19 yng Nghymru.

item.title: Cerbydau trydan yn 'peryglu bywydau' pobl ddall
item.description: Elusennau'n dweud bod angen tynhau rheolau er mwyn diogelu pobl sydd Ã¢ nam golwg.

item.title: Bydd gan Jane Dodds 'neges unigryw' medd Ed Davey
item.description: Ni fu "unrhyw opsiwn" i Jane Dodds fod yn rhan o Lywodraeth Cymru, meddai Syr Ed Davey.

item.title: 3 Llun: Lluniau pwysicaf Angharad Mair
item.description: Y cyflwynwraig sy'n rhannu ei lluniau mwyaf arwyddocaol

item.title: Cwpan y Byd Merched 2023: Ai dyma'r ymgyrch i Gymru?
item.description: Dyma'r cwestiwn oedd ar wefusau pawb wrth holi'r chwaraewyr yr wythnos hon, medd Owain Llyr.
